metadata.title: Highly convergent synthesis and antiviral activity of (E)-but-2-enyl nucleoside phosphonoamidates

abstract.original_text: Several hitherto unknown (E)-but-2-enyl nucleoside phosphonoamidate analogs (ANPs) were prepared directed with nitrogen reagents by cross-metathesis in water-under ultrasound irradiation. Two diastereoisomers were formally identified by X-ray diffraction. These compounds were evaluated against a large spectrum of DNA and RNA viruses. Among them, the phosphonoamidate thymine analogue 19 emerged as the best prodrug against varicella-zoster virus (VZV) with EC 50 values of 0.33 and 0.39 mM for wild-type and thymidine kinase deficient strains, respectively, and a selectivity index !200 mM. This breakthrough approach paves the way for new purine and pyrimidine (E)-but-2-enyl phosphonoamidate analogs.
